title: constant `maximum execution time exceeded' messages
body:
i'm seeing many many `fatal error: maximum execution time of 3600 seconds exceeded' messages. with owncloud 5.10

the message comes almost immediately.  i upped the timeout to 36000 seconds (ten hours), and that sometimes helps --- i suspect there's a php bug here in that the timeout that is timing out is not the maximum execution time timeout but a much shorter one.  you can see from the backtrace that the timeout is taking less than a second.

here's a sample traceback:

fatal error: maximum execution time of 36000 seconds exceeded in /var/www/owncloud/3rdparty/patchwork/php/shim/normalizer.php on line 86
call stack
no.	time	memory	function	location
1	0.0001	243392	{main}( )	../index.php:0
2	0.0091	487824	oc::handlerequest( )	../index.php:28
3	0.1149	1924288	oc::loadappscriptfile( )	../base.php:672
4	0.1164	1926024	require_once( '/var/www/owncloud/apps/files/index.php' )	../base.php:691
5	0.1221	1934248	oc\files\filesystem::getdirectorycontent( )	../index.php:61
6	0.1221	1934808	oc\files\view->getdirectorycontent( )	../filesystem.php:642
7	0.1255	1988288	oc\files\cache\scanner->scan( )	../view.php:808
8	0.1287	2012856	oc\files\cache\scanner->scanchildren( )	../scanner.php:132
9	0.1539	2116968	oc\files\cache\scanner->scanfile( )	../scanner.php:164
10	0.1545	2117928	oc\files\cache\cache->incache( )	../scanner.php:92
11	0.1545	2117928	oc\files\cache\cache->getid( )	../cache.php:330
12	0.1545	2117928	oc\files\cache\cache->normalize( )	../cache.php:291
13	0.1545	2117928	oc_util::normalizeunicode( )	../cache.php:596
14	0.1546	2117928	patchwork\php\shim\normalizer::normalize( )	../util.php:867
15	0.1546	2118152	patchwork\php\shim\normalizer::recompose( )	../normalizer.php:71

environment:
  -- debian unstable on amd64
  -- apache 2.4
  -- php 5.5.1

i'm using user_pwauth for authentication, mysql backend, and am in australia/nsw timezone (10 hours ahead of utc).
